items.sentence: Tom probably isn't going to be late for dinner.
Tom probably isn't going to do that by himself.
Tom probably isn't going to forget his promise.
I think capital punishment should be abolished.
I wonder whether Tom will come to school today.
Look at those black clouds. It's going to rain.
Tom tried talking to Mary, but she ignored him.
Tom opened his umbrella as it began to drizzle.
Tom sneezes quite often. He may have hay fever.
Live and let live, is Tom's philosophy of life.
The only light in the room was a dim red light.
My mother was the one who taught me how to sew.
Tom gave Mary some money to buy some chocolate.
Have you ever wondered why that doesn't happen?
We try to go to Australia at least once a year.
We've been living in Australia for a long time.
Where does your mother think you are right now?
I really liked the dance that we saw yesterday.
I don't know when the concert's going to start.
I hope you aren't going to do that by yourself.
